text: I was thinking "man I really hate it when packages have 600 line doc strings right in the middle of their code, I wish it were easier to have a separate file or something for declaring doc strings"... but guess what, it already is that easy, you can just do `@doc "this is a docstring" f` anywhere in the module, and it works.  It would be nice if people took advantage of this more often

text: I do really like having some reasonably short doc string on every module, struct, and function (even internal ones), so that you can get some info from ?, but yes, huge details are better off in real docs.

text: I think if you have relatively short doc strings which you can realistically expect to be useful to somebody working on the package you should leave them where they are, but if you have huge exposition that nobody working on it will ever look at like in DataFrames.jl, probably good to move them.  I also wish people would add short doc strings more frequently for commonly used "internal" functions
